name: Annotate
title: Google
Cloud
Vision
Annotate
description:
Annotate

Accumulates configuration for an image annotation request. Users describe the type of Google Cloud Vision API tasks to perform over images by configuring features such as faces, landmarks, text, etc. This configuration captures the Cloud Vision API vertical to operate on and the number of top-scoring results to return.

See Project#annotate.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/vision"

vision = Google::Cloud::Vision.new

face_image = vision.image "path/to/face.jpg"
landmark_image = vision.image "path/to/landmark.jpg"

annotations = vision.annotate do |annotate|
   annotate.annotate face_image, faces: true, labels: true
   annotate.annotate landmark_image, landmarks: true
end

annotations[0].faces.count #=> 1
annotations[0].labels.count #=> 4
annotations[1].landmarks.count #=> 1

methods.name: annotate
title: Google
Cloud
Vision
Annotate#annotate
methods.description:
Performs detection of Cloud Vision features on the given images. If no options for features are provided, all image detection features will be performed, with a default of 100 results for faces, landmarks, logos, and labels. If any feature option is provided, only the specified feature detections will be performed. Please review Pricing before use, as a separate charge is incurred for each feature performed on an image.

Cloud Vision sets upper limits on file size as well as on the total combined size of all images in a request. Reducing your file size can significantly improve throughput; however, be careful not to reduce image quality in the process. See Best Practices - Image Sizing for current file size limits.

See Project#annotate for requests that do not involve multiple feature configurations.

resources.title:
Cloud
Vision API Requests and Responses

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/vision"

vision = Google::Cloud::Vision.new

face_image = vision.image "path/to/face.jpg"
landmark_image = vision.image "path/to/landmark.jpg"
text_image = vision.image "path/to/text.png"

annotations = vision.annotate do |annotate|
   annotate.annotate face_image, faces: true, labels: true
   annotate.annotate landmark_image, landmarks: true
   annotate.annotate text_image, text: true
end

annotations[0].faces.count #=> 1
annotations[0].labels.count #=> 4
annotations[1].landmarks.count #=> 1
annotations[2].text.pages.count #=> 1

params.name: images
params.description: The image or images to annotate. This can be an Image instance, or any other type that converts to an Image. See #image for details.

params.name: faces
params.description:
Whether to perform the facial
detection feature. The maximum number of results is configured in
Google::Cloud::Vision.default_max_faces, or may be provided here.
Optional.

params.name: landmarks
params.description:
Whether to perform the landmark
detection feature. The maximum number of results is configured in
Google::Cloud::Vision.default_max_landmarks, or may be provided
here. Optional.

params.name: logos
params.description:
Whether to perform the logo detection
feature. The maximum number of results is configured in
Google::Cloud::Vision.default_max_logos, or may be provided here.
Optional.

params.name: labels
params.description:
Whether to perform the label
detection feature. The maximum number of results is configured in
Google::Cloud::Vision.default_max_labels, or may be provided here.
Optional.

params.name: text
params.description:
Whether to perform the text detection feature
(OCR for shorter documents with sparse text). Optional.

params.name: document
params.description:
Whether to perform the document text
detection feature (OCR for longer documents with dense text).
Optional.

params.name: safe_search
params.description:
Whether to perform the safe search
feature. Optional.

params.name: properties
params.description:
Whether to perform the image properties
feature (currently, the imageâ€™s dominant colors.) Optional.

params.name: crop_hints
params.description:
Whether to perform the crop hints
feature. Optional.

params.name: web
params.description:
Whether to perform the web annotation
feature. Optional.

returns.description: The results for all image detections, returned as a single Annotation instance for one image, or as an array of Annotation instances, one per image, for multiple images.
